data.title: Arnold Schwarzenegger Facts
data.meta_description: Arnold Schwarzenegger is an Austrian-American actor, former professional bodybuilder, businessman, and served as California's 38<sup>th</sup> Governor from 2003 to 2011. He was born Arnold Alois Schwarzenegger on July 30<sup>th</sup>, 1947 in Thal, Styria, to Aurelia and Gustav Schwarzenegger. Arnold was involved heavily in sports as a child but chose bodybuilding over soccer when he was 14. Arnold has said that he suffered from child abuse by his father growing up and it was somewhat normal in society then as parents wanted their children to conform. He served a year in the Austrian Army as was required. He went AWOL during training to win the Junior Mr. Europe contest. His career in bodybuilding continued and he moved to California and went on to win Mr. Olympia seven times.
data.text: Interesting Arnold Schwarzenegger Facts: Arnold's brother died in a car accident in 1971 because he was drinking and driving. Arnold paid for his brother's son's education and helped him move to the U.S. Arnold was shooting 'Pumping Iron' in the U.S. when his father died. He did not attend his funeral. Arnold stayed in touch with his mother until she died. While still in Europe Arnold was voted best built man in Europe, which led to him becoming famous. In the Mr. Universe content in 1966 in London Arnold placed second to Chester Yorton. Arnold won Mr. Universe in 1967. He was 20 and the youngest to win the title. Arnold moved to California in 1968. He started a bricklaying business and was successful, and began to sell bodybuilding equipment. Arnold started acting in the 1970s. He was in Hercules in New York, and The Long Goodbye. In 1976 Arnold won a Golden Globe for New Male Star of the Year. Arnold's breakthrough role was in Conan the Barbarian in 1982. He performed many stunts and suffered a back injury. Arnold Schwarzenegger married Maria Shriver in 1986. She is the niece of President John F. Kennedy. They had four children together named Christopher, Patrick, Christina, and Katherine. In 1984 Arnold starred in the Terminator and in 1987 Arnold was in the movie Predator. Arnold continued to act in movies such as True Lies (1994), The 6th Day (2000), Terminator 2 (1991) Junior (1994), Batman and Robin (1997), End of Days (1999), The Expendables 1, 2 and 3, Terminator 2,3, and Genisys, and many more. Arnold Schwarzenegger is a registered Republican and often had views that contrasted with other well-known celebrities. Arnold announced his bid for Governor of California in 2003 while on The Tonight Show with Jay Leno. Arnold won his seat as governor in a special election. He did so well that he was elected again in 2006. In 2011 Arnold left office as Governor and soon after his marriage ended. It was discovered that he had fathered a child with a staff member in his household. Arnold has written a memoir titled Total Recall.
